venue.name: Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium
venue.address: Calle Sevilla Fútbol Club, s/n, 41005 Sevilla, Spain

Presidential Box.Description: Exclusive seating area offering the best view and luxury experience at Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium.
Presidential Box.View_Quality: Central view from the best vantage point, exceptionally immersive.
Presidential Box.Unique_Features: Luxury seating, highest level of privacy and exclusivity.
Presidential Box.Accessibility: VIP access with personal assistance, best access routes.
Presidential Box.Special_Perks: Gourmet dining options, meet-and-greet opportunities with players.

VIP Seats.Description: Premium seats with excellent pitch views and exclusive benefits, ensuring an unforgettable match day experience.
VIP Seats.View_Quality: Unmatched side views, close to the action.
VIP Seats.Unique_Features: Comfortable seating, complimentary snacks and beverages.
VIP Seats.Special_Perks: Access to VIP lounges, special events invitations.

Grandstand.Description: Elevated side views for an optimal viewing experience, combining great visibility and value.
Grandstand.View_Quality: Excellent perspective of the entire pitch, clear line of sight.
Grandstand.Unique_Features: Good balance of view quality and ticket price.
Grandstand.Accessibility: Easy access, available facilities for guests with disabilities.
Grandstand.Special_Perks: A popular choice among regular fans for its great value.

General Admission.Description: Affordable tickets providing access to vibrant atmosphere areas, perfect for die-hard fans.
General Admission.View_Quality: Dynamic view of the game, engaging fan experience.
General Admission.Unique_Features: Access to the heart of the fan sections, lively atmosphere.
General Admission.Accessibility: Standard access, dedicated areas for wheelchair users.
General Admission.Special_Perks: Part of the passionate fan base, traditional stadium experience.

restaurants_bars.name: Abantal
restaurants_bars.address: Calle Alcalde José de la Bandera, 7, 41003 Sevilla, Spain
restaurants_bars.description: Seville's first Michelin-starred restaurant, offering innovative Andalusian cuisine by renowned chef Julio Fernández.

restaurants_bars.name: Eslava
restaurants_bars.description: A favorite among locals, known for its award-winning tapas and cozy atmosphere, located in the historic San Lorenzo neighborhood.

restaurants_bars.name: La Azotea
restaurants_bars.address: Calle Jesús del Gran Poder, 31, 41002 Sevilla, Spain
restaurants_bars.description: A contemporary tapas bar offering a selection of creative dishes and local wines, with multiple locations throughout the city.

restaurants_bars.name: El Rinconcillo
restaurants_bars.description: Established in 1670, this is the oldest tapas bar in Seville, serving traditional Andalusian fare in a historic setting.

restaurants_bars.name: Mercado Lonja del Barranco
restaurants_bars.description: A gourmet market located in a 19th-century iron building by the river, offering a variety of fresh food stalls and dining options.

restaurants_bars.name: Dos de Mayo
restaurants_bars.address: Plaza de la Gavidia, 6, 41002 Sevilla, Spain
restaurants_bars.description: Known for its bustling atmosphere and delicious tapas, this spot is a must-visit for those looking to experience the authentic Sevillian way of life.

accommodations.name: Hotel Alfonso XIII
accommodations.description: A landmark luxury hotel offering exquisite rooms and exceptional service, located close to Seville's historic attractions.

accommodations.name: EME Catedral Hotel
accommodations.description: This stylish boutique hotel is situated just steps away from the Cathedral, offering modern accommodations and a rooftop terrace with panoramic city views.

accommodations.name: Hotel Casa 1800 Sevilla
accommodations.description: A charming hotel located in the heart of the Santa Cruz district, featuring beautifully restored 19th-century architecture and luxurious amenities.

accommodations.name: Hotel Fernando III
accommodations.description: A comfortable hotel offering spacious rooms and a rooftop pool, located within walking distance to major tourist attractions.

accommodations.name: Las Casas de la Judería
accommodations.address: Calle Santa María la Blanca, 5, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
accommodations.description: This unique hotel complex of restored historic houses is connected by courtyards and passageways, offering a truly authentic stay in the old Jewish quarter.

accommodations.name: Hotel Sevilla Center
accommodations.address: Avenida de la Buhaira, 24, 41018 Sevilla, Spain
accommodations.description: A modern hotel offering excellent facilities and services, located in a convenient area for exploring Seville's cultural and historical sights.

tourist_attractions.name: Real Alcázar de Sevilla
tourist_attractions.address: Patio de Banderas, s/n, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: A stunning example of Mudéjar architecture, this royal palace is one of Seville's most visited attractions, featuring beautiful gardens and ornate rooms.

tourist_attractions.name: Seville Cathedral and Giralda
tourist_attractions.address: Avenida de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: The largest Gothic cathedral in the world, home to the tomb of Christopher Columbus and the iconic Giralda tower, offering panoramic views of the city.

tourist_attractions.name: Plaza de España
tourist_attractions.address: Av. Isabel la Católica, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: A landmark square in Seville known for its semi-circular architecture, tiled alcoves representing Spanish provinces, and canal where visitors can rent boats.

tourist_attractions.name: Parque de María Luisa
tourist_attractions.address: Paseo de las Delicias, s/n, 41013 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: Seville's main public park, adjacent to Plaza de España, offering lush gardens, fountains, and romantic pathways.

tourist_attractions.name: Metropol Parasol
tourist_attractions.address: Plaza de la Encarnación, s/n, 41003 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: Known locally as Las Setas, this modern wooden structure in the old quarter offers an archaeological museum, a market, panoramic terraces, and a viewpoint.

tourist_attractions.name: Torre del Oro
tourist_attractions.address: Paseo de Cristóbal Colón, s/n, 41001 Sevilla, Spain
tourist_attractions.description: A military watchtower built in the 13th century, offering a naval museum and views over the Guadalquivir River.

team_related_activities.name: Sevilla FC Official Store at Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán
team_related_activities.address: Calle Sevilla Fútbol Club, s/n, 41005 Sevilla, Spain
team_related_activities.description: The official store for Sevilla FC merchandise, offering a wide range of team apparel and accessories right at the Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium.

team_related_activities.name: Sevilla FC Match Day Experience
team_related_activities.address: Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium, Calle Sevilla Fútbol Club, s/n, 41005 Sevilla, Spain
team_related_activities.description: Attend a Sevilla FC game at the iconic Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium to experience the passion and atmosphere of one of La Liga's historic teams.

team_related_activities.name: Sevilla FC Football Camp
team_related_activities.description: Football camps for young fans and aspiring players, offering coaching and training in the sport under the guidance of Sevilla FC professionals.

team_related_activities.name: Meet & Greet with Sevilla FC Players
team_related_activities.address: Specific events at Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium
team_related_activities.description: Special events organized for fans to meet their favorite Sevilla FC players, get autographs, and take photos.

team_related_activities.name: Sevilla FC Community Outreach Programs
team_related_activities.address: Various community centers and schools in Sevilla
team_related_activities.description: Community programs and initiatives led by Sevilla FC, promoting sportsmanship, teamwork, and football among youth in Sevilla.

options.description: Seville's city bus network offers convenient access to Ramón Sánchez-Pizjuán Stadium, with several lines stopping near the stadium. This provides easy access for visitors coming to see a match or visit the team store.
options.directions: Check the TUSSAM website for bus schedules, routes, and real-time updates.

options.description: Seville's metro system is a quick and efficient way to reach the stadium, with the Nervión and Gran Plaza stations offering direct connections to various parts of the city.
options.directions: For directions and detailed metro schedules, visit the Metro de Sevilla website or use their mobile app.

best_places_to_buy.name: Official Team Website
best_places_to_buy.description: The primary source for all ticket sales, offering guaranteed authenticity and the best seat selections for Sevilla FC games.

best_places_to_buy.name: Entradas.com
best_places_to_buy.description: A reliable ticketing partner offering tickets for various events, including Sevilla FC games, within Spain.

best_places_to_buy.name: Resale Platforms
best_places_to_buy.description: Check reputable resale platforms for tickets, especially for sold-out games. Ensure the platform offers buyer protection and is authorized to sell Sevilla FC tickets.

ticket_purchasing_tips.ways_to_save: Look for family packages or group discounts for savings. Mid-week games may offer lower prices compared to weekend games. Sign up for the team's newsletter for promotional deals.
ticket_purchasing_tips.avoiding_scalpers: Purchase tickets from official sources or reputable platforms to avoid scams. Be cautious of offers that seem too good to be true, and verify the authenticity of tickets when buying from resale sites.
